intro: Relhania pungens, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Relhania pungens is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
